final_answer: The image is funny or satirical because it highlights the ineffectiveness of securing only part of a bicycle. In the left panel, the front wheel is locked to a pole, but in the right panel, it’s revealed that the rest of the bicycle is missing. This shows the irony and futility of the situation: while technically something was locked up (the front wheel), the more important part—the bike frame—was left unsecured and easily taken. It's a humorous take on misplaced priorities and incomplete precautions.
